segment.source: Appendix Information sent to Microsoft during activation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Appendix Information sent to Microsoft during activation (Windows 10)

segment.source: Appendix: Information sent to Microsoft during activation
segment.target: Appendix: Information sent to Microsoft during activation

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Looking for retail activation?
segment.target: Looking for retail activation?

segment.source: Get Help Activating Microsoft Windows
segment.target: Get Help Activating Microsoft Windows

segment.source: When you activate a computer running Windows 10, the following information is sent to Microsoft:
segment.target: When you activate a computer running Windows 10, the following information is sent to Microsoft:

segment.source: The Microsoft product code (a five-digit code that identifies the Windows product you are activating)
segment.target: The Microsoft product code (a five-digit code that identifies the Windows product you are activating)

segment.source: A channel ID or site code that identifies how the Windows product was originally obtained
segment.target: A channel ID or site code that identifies how the Windows product was originally obtained

segment.source: For example, a channel ID or site code identifies whether the product was originally purchased from a retail store, obtained as an evaluation copy, obtained through a volume licensing program, or preinstalled by a computer manufacturer.
segment.target: For example, a channel ID or site code identifies whether the product was originally purchased from a retail store, obtained as an evaluation copy, obtained through a volume licensing program, or preinstalled by a computer manufacturer.

segment.source: The date of installation and whether the installation was successful
segment.target: The date of installation and whether the installation was successful

segment.source: Information that helps confirm that your Windows product key has not been altered
segment.target: Information that helps confirm that your Windows product key has not been altered

segment.source: Computer make and model
segment.target: Computer make and model

segment.source: Version information for the operating system and software
segment.target: Version information for the operating system and software

segment.source: Region and language settings
segment.target: Region and language settings

segment.source: A unique number called a globally unique identifier, which is assigned to your computer
segment.target: A unique number called a globally unique identifier, which is assigned to your computer

segment.source: Product key (hashed) and product ID
segment.target: Product key (hashed) and product ID

segment.source: BIOS name, revision number, and revision date
segment.target: BIOS name, revision number, and revision date

segment.source: Volume serial number (hashed) of the hard disk drive
segment.target: Volume serial number (hashed) of the hard disk drive

segment.source: The result of the activation check
segment.target: The result of the activation check

segment.source: This includes error codes and the following information about any activation exploits and related malicious or unauthorized software that was found or disabled:
segment.target: This includes error codes and the following information about any activation exploits and related malicious or unauthorized software that was found or disabled:

segment.source: The activation exploit’s identifier
segment.target: The activation exploit’s identifier

segment.source: The activation exploit’s current state, such as cleaned or quarantined
segment.target: The activation exploit’s current state, such as cleaned or quarantined

segment.source: Computer manufacturer’s identification
segment.target: Computer manufacturer’s identification

segment.source: The activation exploit’s file name and hash in addition to a hash of related software components that may indicate the presence of an activation exploit
segment.target: The activation exploit’s file name and hash in addition to a hash of related software components that may indicate the presence of an activation exploit

segment.source: The name and a hash of the contents of your computer’s startup instructions file
segment.target: The name and a hash of the contents of your computer’s startup instructions file

segment.source: If your Windows license is on a subscription basis, information about how your subscription works
segment.target: If your Windows license is on a subscription basis, information about how your subscription works

segment.source: Standard computer information is also sent, but your computer’s IP address is only retained temporarily.
segment.target: Standard computer information is also sent, but your computer’s IP address is only retained temporarily.

segment.source: Use of information
segment.target: Use of information

segment.source: Microsoft uses the information to confirm that you have a licensed copy of the software.
segment.target: Microsoft uses the information to confirm that you have a licensed copy of the software.

segment.source: Microsoft does not use the information to contact individual consumers.
segment.target: Microsoft does not use the information to contact individual consumers.

segment.source: For additional details, see Windows 10 Privacy Statement.
segment.target: For additional details, see Windows 10 Privacy Statement.

segment.source: See also
segment.target: See also

segment.source: Volume Activation for Windows 10
segment.target: Volume Activation for Windows 10
